required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Blue Light Imaging (BLI) With Flexible Spectral-Imaging Color Enhancement (FICE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Concurrence Study of Diagnostic Visualization Comparing Blue Light Imaging (BLI) With Flexible Spectral-Imaging Color Enhancement (FICE)

brief_summary.textblock: The study is intended to demonstrate substantial equivalence of visualization using BLI to the predicate device, FICE, so as to support the addition of BLI as an adjunct to white light imaging in the company's video processor.

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical study will consist of acquisition of images, followed by a reader study.

primary_outcome.measure: Image Quality Scores Using Likert Scale

arm_group.description: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject.

intervention.description: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referred for clinically indicated gastrointestinal diagnostic endoscopy
- Ability to understand the requirements of the study, to provide written informed consent and to comply with the study protocol
- Ability to understand and provide written authorization for the use and disclosure of protected health information (PHI) per the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) privacy ruling.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under the age of 21 years
- Is an inmate (see US Code of Federal Regulations 45 C.F.R. 46.306)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects enrolled had been referred to Mayo Clinic for clinically indicated gastrointestinal diagnostic endoscopy between August 19, 2016 and September 7, 2016.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each subject underwent a complete diagnostic endoscopy examination with white light, followed by an exam with BLI (BLI + BLI-brt) and FICE, at 3 FICE settings (1,2 & 6). Each subject could contribute up to 2 anatomical sites (regions of interest).

group.title: Single Endoscopy Procedure
group.description: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject. Single Endoscopy Procedure: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject.

group.title: Single Endoscopy Procedure
group.description: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject. Single Endoscopy Procedure: All subjects will have 1 endoscopy procedure, in which they will have a white light examination followed by FICE and BLI imaging on a maximum of two (2) anatomical sites per subject.

outcome.title: Image Quality Scores Using Likert Scale
outcome.population: All patients had imaging done with white light (standard) as well as BLI, BLI-brt, and FICE. Each of the three (3) Readers had a unique set of randomized images which they reviewed independently during the reader study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
